summary_md: Recast the partition problem via the conflict graph G (vertices E; edge x–y iff ∃ p≠q with f_p(x)=f_q(y)), so required parts = χ(G). Main findings: (i) Permutation template f_i(π)=π(i) on E⊆S_k gives G complete, n*=(k−1)!, χ=k! so χ=k·n* (hence any universal linear bound χ≤c(k)n* must have c(k)≥k). (ii) A derangement-augmented variant yields prescribed n with complete G and χ=D_k+kn (e.g. k=3,n=1 → K5). (iii) Projective-plane (k=q+1) gives |f_i^{-1}(z)|=1 ∀i,z but G complete on k^2−k+1 vertices (n*=1) — tight in the bijection regime. (iv) Forbidding r permutation matchings yields factorial cores E_0(r) with |E|≥((1−r/k)^k)k! (van der Waerden), so strengthened small-fibre conditions still admit factorial χ. Pair-coverage yields upper bounds m≤k^2−k+1 (bijective) and corrected uniform r-to-1 bound m≤r k(k−1)+1. Citations: papers/paper1.txt
highlights: Conflict-graph viewpoint: valid partition ⇔ proper coloring, parts = χ(G).
Permutation template (f_i(π)=π(i)) gives complete G with n*=(k−1)!, χ=k! ⇒ χ=k·n*, so c(k)≥k.
Derangement-augmented construction: E=D_k ∪ ⋃_s E_s yields prescribed n and complete G with χ=D_k+kn (k=3,n=1 → K5).
Projective-plane family (k=q+1) attains |f_i^{-1}(z)|=1 and complete G on k^2−k+1 vertices (bijective regime, tight).
Factorial cores E_0(r) avoiding r matchings give |E_0(r)|≥((1−r/k)^k)k! (van der Waerden), so factorial χ persists under strong small-fibre constraints.
Pair-coverage inequality yields bijection bound m≤k^2−k+1 and uniform r-to-1 bound m≤r k(k−1)+1.
next_questions: Formalize E_0(r) existence/counts rigorously (Hall/rook-polynomials/van der Waerden/Brégman asymptotics).
Prove pinned-completion existence (one forced cell) via Hall or LLL to extend constructions for n>1.
Characterize structural hypotheses (surjectivity, balanced fibres, incidence/edge-coloring) that restore subfactorial or linear upper bounds on χ(G).
